metaDescription: Find top-rated financial advisors in Janesville. Expert guidance for retirement planning, wealth management, and investment strategies.

advisors.name: Edward Jones - Financial Advisor: Lonnie M Klecker, CFP®|ABFP®|AAMS®

heroDescription: Janesville, Wisconsin, is a vibrant city known for its rich history and diverse economy.
landscapeDescription: With a population of 63,820, Janesville has a stable economic base, primarily driven by manufacturing, healthcare, and retail sectors. The city is strategically located along major highways, enhancing its connectivity.
uniqueNeeds: Janesville requires investment in workforce development and infrastructure to support its growing industries.
citySpecificRiskAdvice: Janesville's manufacturing focus poses risks from economic downturns. Real estate may face volatility; consider diversification. Flooding is a concern; prepare for weather-related impacts.

sections.title: Economic Growth
sections.description: According to BEA (2023), Janesville's economy has shown steady growth, driven by a resurgence in manufacturing and service sectors.

sections.title: Wealth Demographics
sections.description: According to Census (2023), the median income in Janesville is approximately $58,000, reflecting a diverse economic landscape.

sections.title: Advisor Specializations
sections.description: Based on BLS (2023), financial advisors in Janesville are increasingly focusing on retirement planning and investment strategies tailored to local industries.

sections.title: Cost of Living
sections.description: According to BLS (2024), Janesville's cost of living is lower than the national average, making it an attractive place for families and retirees.

sections.title: Real Estate Market
sections.description: According to Zillow (2024), the real estate market in Janesville is stable, with moderate price appreciation and a healthy inventory of homes.

sections.title: Business Environment
sections.description: According to Fortune (2024), Janesville's business climate is favorable, with supportive local policies and a strong network of small businesses.
